column2: SIZE is the natural logarithm of the firm's total assets
The (FSD) foreign sales dummy equals I if the company reports any foreign sales, 0 otherwise.
FSTS is the ratio of foreign sales to total sales.
(book value of assets less book value of equity plus the market value of equity) divided by the book value of assets.
The FXD dummy equals I if the company reports currency derivatives.
Gross value of FXD is defined as the gross national value of the use of any foreign curnency instruments
DERIV is defined as the notional amount of FXD divided by foreign sales
R&D/sales is research and development expenses scaled by sales.
column11: Share price 31/12 (est = x cost of EQ - dividend)

column2: Leverage is the ratio of total debt to shareholder equity
Capex/sales is capital expenditures scaled by sales
ROA is the  net income divided by total assets.
Dividend dummy; 1 for paid dividend and 0 for no dividend
1 if the firm operates in more than one sector and 0 if operates only to one
Gains and losses on derivatives used to hedge foreign cash flow exposure
Dummy variable that takes 1 if there are gains from hedging derivatives and 0 otherwise.
